short_summary: For Provision of Tree Planting Services in Gros Morne National Park
description: The Main contract includes Planting of 300,000 tree seedlings in the park area in a target density of 3500 seedlings per hectare.
full_summary:
# Provision of Tree Planting Services in Gros Morne National Park

## Request for Proposal (RFP) Number

RFP Number: 5P300-24-0038/A
Revision Number: 2
Published Date: June 18, 2024

## Tender Closing Date and Time

The closing date and time for bid submission is July 16, 2024 at 14:00 EDT.

## Contract Details

The Parks Canada Agency is seeking a Contractor to provide tree planting services in Gros Morne National Park. The contractor is required to plant 300,000 tree seedlings in disturbed forest habitat at a target density of 3500 seedlings per hectare. The Contractor must perform and complete the work no later than September 27, 2024.

## Notice Type

This RFP is a Request for Proposal (RFP) in accordance with the Government of Canada's purchasing regulations.

## Contact Information

Jillian King,
Contracting Authority,
Parks Canada Agency
30 Victoria Street, Gatineau, Quebec, J8X 0B3
Phone: (873) 354-3521
Email: [jillian.king@pc.gc.ca](mailto:jillian.king@pc.gc.ca)

## Notice and Tender Status

This opportunity has expired and is no longer accepting bids.

## Tender Documents

The tender documents, including the Request for Proposal (RFP) and Bid Solicitation, can be found at the following link: 
<https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities>

## Instructions for Submitting Bids

Bids must be submitted via email or fax to the Contracting Authority at the specified addresses below. Please ensure that your bid is submitted in compliance with the instructions outlined in the tender documents.

* Fax: 1-877-558-2349
* Email: soumissionsest-bidseast@pc.gc.ca

Please note that bids submitted in person or by courier will not be accepted. It is also important to note that emails containing links to bid documents will not be accepted. Bid documents must be sent as attachments to the email.

## Language of Document

The RFP and all bid documents are written in both English and French. If you find any discrepancies between the English and French documents, please notify the Contracting Authority immediately so that we can rectify the situation. Please ensure that your bid is submitted in either English or French.
